```{python}
from scapy.all import *
```

```{python}
ports = [25,80,53,443,445,8080,8443]
```

```{python}
def SynScan(host):
    ans,unans = sr(IP(dst=host)/TCP(dport=ports,flags="S"),timeout=2,verbose=0)
    print("Open ports at %s:" % host)
    for (s,r,) in ans:
        if s[TCP].dport == r[TCP].sport:
            print(s[TCP].dport)
```

```{python}
def DNSScan(host):
    ans,unans = sr(IP(dst=host)/UDP(dport=53)/DNS(rd=1,qd=DNSQR(qname="google.com")),timeout=2,verbose=0)
    if ans:
        print("DNS Server at %s"%host)
```

```{python}
# Note: These comands interact with sockets, which requires elevated privileges
# So they must be prformed as root (sudo)

for host in ["8.8.8.8", "192.168.1.62", "192.168.1.1"]:
    SynScan(host)
    DNSScan(host)
```
